item.title: Hangout Highlights – Grid System Enemy Spawning And Working With Tables
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 175, we continued our twin stick shooter game development series with a look at the grid system used to spawn new enemies and determine their starting proximity to the player. We also discussed global variables and functions, and introduced code to save, load, and inspect table data. Here are clips from the Hangout.
item.content:encoded:
Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 175, we continued our twin stick shooter game development series with a look at the grid system used to spawn new enemies and determine their starting proximity to the player. We also discussed global variables and functions, and introduced code to save, load, and inspect table data.

If you missed the Hangout, here are clips to help you catch up. Watch the entire conversation, or just the parts that interest you most.

Part 1 – Getting moved into the Perk office

Part 2 – Twin Stick Shooter Project Review

Part 3 – Game Element Highlights

Part 4 – Grid System Spawning

Part 5 – Grid System Code Review

Part 6 – Deep Copying Tables

Part 7 – Benefits of Table Dumps

Also, be sure to catch this week’s Hangout on creating custom HUDs and using shuffling techniques.

Thank you for watching, listening, and following Corona Geek:

  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
  • Download Corona Geek on iTunes
  • Follow Corona Geek on Facebook

item.title: Corona Geek #175 – Twin Stick Game Development – Writing Code – Part 1
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: On today's Corona Geek Hangout we continued our twin stick shooter game development series with a look at the grid system used to spawn new enemies and determine their starting proximity to the player. We also discussed global variables and functions, and introduced code to save, load, and inspect table data. Download the project code and make it your own.
item.content:encoded:
On today’s Corona Geek Hangout we continued our twin stick shooter game development series with a look at the grid system used to spawn new enemies and determine their starting proximity to the player. We also discussed global variables and functions, and introduced code to save, load, and inspect table data.

Download the project code and make it your own.

Show Notes:

  • Download a Composer Swipe Extension
  • Learn Corona SDK from Dr. Brian Burton
  • Watch Corona University Videos
  • Corona IRC Channel

Thank you for watching, listening, and following Corona Geek:

  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
  • Download Corona Geek on iTunes
  • Follow Corona Geek on Facebook

item.title: Hangout Highlights – Geometry Wars Twin Stick Shooter Game Overview
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 174, we started a new game development series on creating a twin stick shooter game modeled after Geometry Wars. We stepped through an overview of the game’s design and the key game mechanics we will replicate in our own twin stick shooter. Here are clips from the hangout.
item.content:encoded:
Last week on Corona Geek Hangout 174, we started a new game development series on creating a twin stick shooter game modeled after Geometry Wars. We stepped through an overview of the game’s design and the key game mechanics we will replicate during the development of our own twin stick shooter.

If you missed the Hangout, here are clips to help you catch up. Watch the entire conversation, or just the parts that interest you most.

Part 1 – Community Announcements

Part 2 – Geometry Wars Retro Evolved Overview

Part 3 – Enemy Types

Part 4 – Obstacles

Part 5 – Optimizations and Extras

Part 6 – Performance Tricks

Part 7 – Twin Stick Shooter Sample Project Demo

Be sure to watch next week’s Hangout on Creating Twin Stick Shooter Games, Part 1. In the meantime, download source code for the sample project.

Thank you for watching, listening, and following Corona Geek:

  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
  • Download Corona Geek on iTunes
  • Follow Corona Geek on Facebook
